info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 10 at 10:40PM CDT until May 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN COTTLE...MOTLEY AND SOUTHERN HALL COUNTIES... At 1038 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Flomot to 13 miles northwest of Delwin, moving northeast at 55 mph. These storms have a history of producing destructive wind gusts to nearly 80 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR MUCH OF MOTLEY COUNTY, INCLUDING THE CITIES OF MATADOR AND NORTHFIELD. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Matador, Turkey, Flomot, Northfield, Cee Vee and Roaring Springs. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: These storms are producing destructive winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
